result.execSummary:
The defendant Kristina L. Pruitt-Ziegler was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Kristina L. Pruitt-Ziegler is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Kristina L. Pruitt-Ziegler was found guilty of OWI (1st w/ Passenger < 16 Yrs Old), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Kenosha County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: Bond to apply.  Balance to be paid within first year of probation.
Bond to apply.  Balance to be paid within first year of probation.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.
*  Pay supervision fees.
*  Pay fine of $350.00 and court costs including all applicable surcharges (bond to apply; balance to be paid within first year of probation).
*  Submit to a DNA sample and pay surcharge.
*  Pay costs of legal representation or Advocate Counsel fees for the defense of the case, to be determined within 45 days (Greg Bates).
Spend 29 days in the county jail w/credit for 29 days served - Time Served.  May not have contact with Shopko Store.  The Department shall promptly notify the court of any new arrest or criminal charge made against the Deft.

timeConds.notes: Credit for 29 days served.  TIME SERVED.

*Not to transport any children.  *Not to possess or consume Alcohol.  *Not To Possess or Consume Controlled Substances w/o a Prescription.  If released, Report to WCS by 11:00 the next business day; Submit to random UA's upon request.  Comply w/ all program requirements & provide all required information.
346.63(1)(a) -OWI 1st w/a Minor Child in the Vehicle   946.49(1)(b) -Felony BJ

Attorney James Kraus appeared for the State. Def. appeared (in custody) with Atty. Gregory Bates. Clerk LE.  Plea offer placed on the record by ADA Kraus.  Prelim. waived, probable cause found. Bound over to Br. 7. Information filed, plea of not guilty. Judicial pretrial on 4-23-14 @ 1:30pm. Atty. Bates has filed bond motion in 14CF163, however he intended to file on in this file. Atty. Bates moves to amend the caption in the motion to reflect file 14CF180. Bond motion argued. Court amends bond to $500 cash bond with the following conditions: not to be transporting any children, not to possess or consume alcohol, not to possess or consume controlled substances without a prescription, and if released, report to WCS by 11:00am the next business day. Submit to random UAs upon request. Comply with all program requirements and provide all required information.
